decks.notes: This Naya Aggro deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creatures and spells to apply pressure and quickly bring down the opponent's life total. It includes powerful creatures like Kumano Faces Kakkazan, Adeline, Resplendent Cathar, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, as well as spells like Lightning Helix and Destroy Evil to control the board and remove threats. The deck also includes a mix of lands to ensure consistent mana production and the ability to cast spells on curve. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and efficient removal.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of removal, creatures, and planeswalkers to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Glissa Sunslayer, along with efficient removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down, this deck aims to maintain board control while dealing damage. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption, while Questing Druid and Mosswood Dreadknight help provide a consistent stream of threats. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent casting of spells and creatures to pressure the opponent from the early turns of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Spell Pierce, Negate, and Memory Deluge, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also drawing into key pieces with The Wandering Emperor and Wandering Mind. The deck also includes efficient removal options like Lightning Helix and No More Lies to deal with threats on the board. Overall, the strategy revolves around staying ahead on resources and answers, ultimately outlasting the opponent to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back to the battlefield for a game-winning combo. It utilizes cards like The Cruelty of Gix, Wail of the Forgotten, and Black Sun's Twilight to manipulate the graveyard, while also including reanimation spells like Edgar's Awakening and Invasion of Amonkhet to bring back key creatures. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Make Disappear and Collector's Vault to control the game until the combo can be set up. With a mix of graveyard manipulation, reanimation, and control elements, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays utilizing a mix of creatures with high power and evasion abilities. It also includes control elements to disrupt opponent's strategy. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and removal spells, ultimately aiming to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a victory. It features a mix of efficient creatures, disruption spells, and land cards to support the aggressive game plan and maintain consistency in executing the strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to deal damage early and often, using cards like Kumano Faces Kakkazan and Monastery Swiftspear to pressure the opponent. Additionally, cards like Play with Fire and Monstrous Rage can be used to finish off the opponent or deal with threats on the board. With a low mana curve and efficient creatures, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using various spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping up card advantage through draw spells. The deck's win condition is to ultimately outvalue the opponent by outlasting them and overwhelming them with powerful late-game threats. By utilizing a combination of removal, counter spells, and card draw, the deck aims to control the board and dictate the pace of the game until it can establish a dominant position and secure the win.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost and efficient creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Wedding Announcement and Virtue of Loyalty help to increase board presence, while cards like Destroy Evil and Get Lost can disrupt the opponent's strategy. By combining aggro tactics with control elements, the deck aims to maintain a fast-paced offensive while also having the ability to answer threats from the opponent. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to both white and blue mana sources for maximum flexibility in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures and burn spells. The focus is on dealing a lot of damage quickly, using creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Charming Scoundrel, as well as spells like Lightning Strike and Play with Fire. By combining creatures with haste and efficient burn spells, the deck aims to take control of the game early and pressure the opponent into making suboptimal decisions. Mishra's Foundry and Sokenzan, Crucible of Defiance provide additional utility and mana fixing to support the aggressive game plan.
